https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]

bors merge
Maybe just `end Extension` before this def?

```suggestion
    (H : f.toRingHom.FormallyEtale) :
    T âŠ—[S] P.CotangentSpace â‰ƒâ‚—[T] Q.CotangentSpace :=
```
EDIT: `RingHom.FormallyEtale` does not yet exist. Maybe add a `-- TODO` to clean this up, when it exists?
I think this proof would profit from factoring these three fields out in separate (private) definitions.
It is a bit hard to do so because of the local instances and definitions above it. Or do you think it would be better if those instances are redeclared in each of the separate definitions?

You could make a section and declare the four instances as `private local instance`s there. I believe the `e` and `f'` are only needed for the `invFun` field. Maybe this then also fixes the currently needed `maxHeartbeats` modification.
Maybe `algebraMap P.Ring P'.Ring = f` would be easier to use?

```suggestion
/-- If `J â‰ƒ Q âŠ—â‚š I`, `S â†’ T` is flat, and `P â†’ Q` is formally etale, then `T âŠ— HÂ¹(L_P) â‰ƒ HÂ¹(L_Q)`. -/
```
Do we already have that `H` follows from the `e.g.`?
We have all the mathematical ingredients but not the exact statement.
Okay, since this PR is already long, let's not make it longer for now.
This is strange, is `(Hâ‚ : FormallyEtale P.Ring Q.Ring)` not sufficient?

```suggestion
A ring homomorphism `R â†’+* A` is formally etale if it is formally unramified and formally smooth.
See `Algebra.FormallyEtale`.
```
